name: unbridged
content:
unbridged adjective
(RIVER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unbridged river, stream, etc. does not have a bridge over a particular part of it: In order to get to church, we had to cross an unbridged river. The route took us over seven, as yet unbridged, canals.
More examplesFewer examplesThe route takes you miles from any habitation, and across several unbridged streams and rivers.The village is surrounded on three sides by unbridged water, and there's just one road in and out.Very few new bridges were built at previously unbridged sites between 1250 and 1550.

unbridged adjective
(DIFFERENCE)
If there is an unbridged difference between two people, groups, or things, it has not been possible to make them understand each other or agree: She worried about the unbridged chasm between Lucy and herself. The climate conference closed with many gaps still unbridged. Related word
bridge
More examplesFewer examplesThe gulf of misunderstanding between the West and the East cannot be left unbridged.All over the world, two classes were forming, with an unbridged chasm between them: the capitalist class, with its enormous fortunes, and the proletariat.There had always been a divide between the former and current members, but it was fast becoming an unbridged gulf.
